macros.sourceContext:
> | {{APIRef("CSS Custom Highlight API")}} ^ |

The delete() method of the {{domxref("HighlightRegistry")}} interface removes a the named {{domxref("Highlight")}} object from the HighlightRegistry.

|

HighlightRegistry is a {{jsxref("Map")}}-like object, so this is similar to using {{jsxref("Map.delete()")}}.

value.content:
The delete() method of the HighlightRegistry interface removes a the named Highlight object from the HighlightRegistry.

HighlightRegistry is a Map-like object, so this is similar to using Map.delete().

value.title: Syntax
value.content:
js

delete(customHighlightName)

value.title: Parameters
value.content:
customHighlightName

The name, as a String, of the Highlight object to remove from the HighlightRegistry.

value.title: Return value
value.content: Returns true if a Highlight object under the provided name was in the HighlightRegistry; otherwise false.

value.title: Examples
value.content:
The following code sample registers a highlight in the registry, and then deletes it:

js

const myHighlight = new Highlight(range1, range2);

CSS.highlights.set("my-highlight", myHighlight);

CSS.highlights.delete("foo"); // false
CSS.highlights.delete("my-highlight"); // true

value.title: See also
value.content:
• The CSS Custom Highlight API
  • CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web
